com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya
Class SystemUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.SystemUtils

@FullyTested
public final class SystemUtils
extends Object

This is a collection of methods to indentify the current operating system.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

Nested Class Summary
static class SystemUtils.OperatingSystem
          This is a large, but certainly not exhausitive, list of operating systems.
static class SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory
          This is an attempt to classify values from SystemUtils.OperatingSystem, and should be considered highly subjective.
 
Method Summary
static SystemUtils.OperatingSystem checkCurrentOperatingSystem(SystemUtils.OperatingSystem... osArr)
          Tests if the current operating system matches any one of a list.
static SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory checkCurrentOperatingSystemCategory(SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory... catArr)
          Tests if the current operating system category matches any one of a list.
static SystemUtils.OperatingSystem getCurrentOperatingSystem()
          Via static initialisation, the current operating system is discovered.
static SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory getCurrentOperatingSystemCategory()
          Via static initialisation, the current operating system is discovered and categorised.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

getCurrentOperatingSystem

@FullyTested
public static SystemUtils.OperatingSystem getCurrentOperatingSystem()
Via static initialisation, the current operating system is discovered. Access that value with this method. In rare cases where it is not possible identify the current operating system via system property os.name, a reference to SystemUtils.OperatingSystem.UNKNOWN is returned.

Returns:
current operating system or SystemUtils.OperatingSystem.UNKNOWN
See Also:
SystemUtils.OperatingSystem, SystemUtils.OperatingSystem.getCategory(), getCurrentOperatingSystemCategory(), SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory, checkCurrentOperatingSystemCategory(OperatingSystemCategory...)

getCurrentOperatingSystemCategory

@FullyTested
public static SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory getCurrentOperatingSystemCategory()
Via static initialisation, the current operating system is discovered and categorised. Access that category with this method. In rare cases where it is not possible identify the current operating system via system property os.name, SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory.UNKNOWN is returned.

Returns:
current operating system category or SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory.UNKNOWN
See Also:
getCurrentOperatingSystem(), SystemUtils.OperatingSystem.getCategory(), SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory, checkCurrentOperatingSystemCategory(OperatingSystemCategory...)

checkCurrentOperatingSystem

@FullyTested
public static SystemUtils.OperatingSystem checkCurrentOperatingSystem(SystemUtils.OperatingSystem... osArr)
Tests if the current operating system matches any one of a list.

Example:

 SystemUtils.checkCurrentOperatingSystem(
     SystemUtils.OperatingSystem.WINDOWS_XP,
     SystemUtils.OperatingSystem.WINDOWS_VISTA,
     SystemUtils.OperatingSystem.WINDOWS_7,
     SystemUtils.OperatingSystem.WINDOWS_8);

Parameters:
osArr - list of operating systems to match
Returns:
current operating system
See Also:
getCurrentOperatingSystem(), checkCurrentOperatingSystemCategory(OperatingSystemCategory...)

checkCurrentOperatingSystemCategory

@FullyTested
public static SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory checkCurrentOperatingSystemCategory(SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory... catArr)
Tests if the current operating system category matches any one of a list.

Example:

 SystemUtils.checkCurrentOperatingSystemCategory(
     SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory.WINDOWS,
     SystemUtils.OperatingSystemCategory.UNIX);

Parameters:
catArr - list of categories to match
Returns:
current category
See Also:
getCurrentOperatingSystem(), checkCurrentOperatingSystem(OperatingSystem...)
